# The `BasicAAResult` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> result object for the basic, local, and stateless alias analysis. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This is the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> result object for the basic, local, and stateless alias analysis.

It implements the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> query interface in an entirely stateless manner. As one consequence, it is never invalidated due to IR changes. While it does retain some storage, that is used as an optimization and not to preserve information from query to query. However it does retain handles to various other analyses and must be recomputed when those analyses are.

Definition at line 41 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-h">BasicAliasAnalysis.h</a>.

### getModRefInfo() {#a43a53dbe445a968ef8851f1a257d4d7c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ModRefInfo BasicAAResult::getModRefInfo (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42; Call, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp; Loc, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaqueryinfo">AAQueryInfo</a> &amp; AAQI)</>}>
Checks to see if the specified callsite can clobber the specified memory object.

Since we only look at local properties of this function, we really can&#39;t say much about this query. We do, however, use simple &quot;address taken&quot; analysis on local objects.

### getModRefInfoMask() {#accb256ada9f5d92e5a776e459618cd1d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ModRefInfo BasicAAResult::getModRefInfoMask (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp; Loc, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaqueryinfo">AAQueryInfo</a> &amp; AAQI, bool IgnoreLocals=false)</>}>
Returns a bitmask that should be unconditionally applied to the ModRef info of a memory location.

This allows us to eliminate Mod and/or Ref from the ModRef info based on the knowledge that the memory location points to constant and/or locally-invariant memory.

If IgnoreLocals is true, then this method returns NoModRef for memory that points to a local alloca.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-h/#l00087">87</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-h">BasicAliasAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#l00738">738</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp">BasicAliasAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### aliasGEP() {#aaac6967e210974ca547a240f8fb9e96c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>AliasResult BasicAAResult::aliasGEP (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gepoperator">GEPOperator</a> &#42; GEP1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/locationsize">LocationSize</a> V1Size, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/locationsize">LocationSize</a> V2Size, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; UnderlyingV1, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; UnderlyingV2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaqueryinfo">AAQueryInfo</a> &amp; AAQI)</>}>
Provides a bunch of ad-hoc rules to disambiguate a GEP instruction against another pointer.

We know that V1 is a GEP, but we don&#39;t know anything about V2. UnderlyingV1 is getUnderlyingObject(GEP1), UnderlyingV2 is the same for V2.

### constantOffsetHeuristic() {#a9081d2ee65e9307c1388f3ba6b3c790c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool BasicAAResult::constantOffsetHeuristic (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/basicaaresult/decomposedgep">DecomposedGEP</a> &amp; GEP, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/locationsize">LocationSize</a> V1Size, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/locationsize">LocationSize</a> V2Size, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assumptioncache">AssumptionCache</a> &#42; AC, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42; DT, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaqueryinfo">AAQueryInfo</a> &amp; AAQI)</>}>
A Heuristic for aliasGEP that searches for a constant offset between the variables.

GetLinearExpression has some limitations, as generally zext(x + 1) != zext(x) + zext(1) if the arithmetic overflows. GetLinearExpression will therefore conservatively refuse to decompose these expressions. However, we know that, for all x, zext(x) != zext(x + 1), even if the addition overflows.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-h/#l00118">118</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-h">BasicAliasAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#l01904">1904</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp">BasicAliasAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isValueEqualInPotentialCycles() {#ac6df020260994339129a0da3ba4ef87f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool BasicAAResult::isValueEqualInPotentialCycles (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V2, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaqueryinfo">AAQueryInfo</a> &amp; AAQI)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> whether two Values can be considered equivalent.

If the values may come from different cycle iterations, this will also check that the values are not part of cycle. We have to do this because we are looking through phi nodes, that is we say noalias(V, phi(VA, VB)) if noalias(V, VA) and noalias(V, VB).

## Private Static Functions

### DecomposeGEPExpression() {#a3334c8974b875c83f227f07d9d360dae}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>BasicAAResult::DecomposedGEP BasicAAResult::DecomposeGEPExpression (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assumptioncache">AssumptionCache</a> &#42; AC, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42; DT)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
If V is a symbolic pointer expression, decompose it into a base pointer with a constant offset and a number of scaled symbolic offsets.

The scaled symbolic offsets (represented by pairs of a Value&#42; and a scale in the VarIndices vector) are Value&#42;&#39;s that are known to be scaled by the specified amount, but which may have other unrepresented high bits. As such, the gep cannot necessarily be reconstructed from its decomposed form.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-h/#l00107">107</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-h">BasicAliasAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#l00576">576</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp">BasicAliasAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
